fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-114].
  {panel}

Requirement: 
In addition to being able to define a static number of weekly hours in a timeframe that a member is available to certain teams, there should be a possibility to allocate people dynamically between teams based on the priority of items in the backlog and where the skills are mostly needed. 

Possible solution approach: 
1) Introduce a field of total weekly hours for a person (not per-team but on the person as an entity)
2) On the weekly hours field, be able to switch between static and dynamic. Static does the same the current implementation, i.e., allowing to specify weekly hours statically allocated to this team in a certain timeframe, dynamic means that the person can be allocated up to the total available time to a team, but across all teams not more than the total weekly hours. Additionally, it should be possible to specify a range, e.g. "can be allocated up to 50% of her time to this team"
The scheduling algorithm, when scheduling by priority order, allocates these flexible capacities greedily to the most important items, i.e. to get something with high priority done first, the according team will get the person allocated by as much as possible. 
This means, people could switch from sprint to sprint flexibly between teams, in Kanban mode even from day to day, working for team A on one day, and team B on another day.
fields.summary: Dynamic switching/allocation of people between multiple teams

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-113].
  {panel}

Use case: 

I have several items on the backlog which I want to manage and keep, but not yet schedule until they are ready for development. 
Currently, as soon as an item has estimates, a team gets assigned automatically - it is not possible to NOT assign a team or exclude items from the schedule. 

Solution idea: 
Move ideas through some sort of staging workflow, from the rough idea until its ready for dev.
Allow to use it for what-if scenarios ("what if we wanted to pick up this idea") but allow to exclude from schedule until a certain stage of the workflow is reached.
fields.summary: Support "staging" of work until it is ready to be planned

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-112].
  {panel}

Scenario: 
For each release stream, I have several teams that can potentially work on it, others are dedicated towards other streams. 

Yet, i cannot assign these teams at the level of a release stream. I need to go through all backlog items and assign them individually. Since with epics (without child stories) I cannot assign multiple teams unless its on auto-calculate, it is impossible for these cases to assign exactly the right teams that are dedicated to my stream of work. 

Suggested solution: Allow to set assignable teams for a release stream (this should be fully optional, if nothing it set, any team can work on any release stream). When this is set, the backlog items can be left to "Calculate" on the team field and the right teams get picked based on the preselection. Also, if I change it on stream level and dedicate another team to a release stream, this change reflects implicitly on all backlog items.
fields.summary: Limit assignable teams for a release stream
Possibility to hide empty release streams

fields.description:
Currently when you try to import issues into the backlog, only when you use the original story and epic issue type from JIRA Agile, then JIRA Portfolio will recognize the correct association under the *Import As* and *Parent* column.

*Example:*
# If you are using the original JIRA Agile *Story* and *Epic* issue type, the association for *Import As* and *Parent* column will reflect the correct association value.
# If let's say you are using a customize issue type such as *User Story*, the automatic association will failed to recognize the *Parent* which will resulted as *New Epic - Imported (default)*
fields.summary: Epic and Story association
No possible to remove team assignment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-101].
  {panel}

Richer reporting with 
- Standard and custom dashboards including drilldowns to reports (dashboards are viewed by company executives to gain visibility to project tracking and pipeline)
- Custom reporting
- Exportable reports (as PDF and / or Word)
- Printable reports
- The releases report should include links to the epic, project or task, this would make it easier to makes changes based on the report result. (The exported release report should include this information as well)
fields.summary: Richer Reporting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-100].
  {panel}

Currently, Jira Portfolio simply forces the start of the next version to be after the current version

This doesn't make sense because:

1. Developers can work across versions concurrently, e.g. some developers in the team are finalising 1.1 while other developers are starting 1.2, and some might even be working on 1.3 or beyond

2. Project managers and Designers need to start their planning and design on a new version before developers and we want to allocate their time on the epics as well
fields.summary: Versions should be able to run concurrently
issues that block issues within the portfolio should be automatically added to the portfolio.
As an project manager I want stories under an epic in the backlog to be "epic linked" with that epic.
As a stream manager I want to have the option to link a stream strictly to a jira project.
As a project manager I want to click on an initiative / epic / story in the graph to see the issue key of the linked issue and highlight it in the backlog

fields.description: Importing issues into plan causes the page to stop responding and references the script <jira-url>/download/resources/com.radiantminds.roadmaps-jira:view-resources/scripts/page-roadmap/script-optimized.js:5552
fields.summary: Import Issues Causes Unresponsive Script on Page
Option to display issue status in "Update plan from date..." dialog

fields.description: I've just upgraded to v1.7 and was very excited to use Story Points. Unfortunately I'm unable to view the schedule as JIRA Portfolio says it is 'Calculating' and it never stops! Luckily I've done this on a test plan and it hasn't affected any of our real ones, I can't convert them until this is resolved.
fields.summary: Perpetual 'Calculating'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-91].
  {panel}

We track target (what the business wants), estimated (what the teams think can be achieved) & actual (what occured) dates for our projects. We do this for key milestones which are critical (especially as we operate in a regulated market).

It would be great if we could:
1) Define the target dates for milestones (ideally we could define milestones for projects / initiatives etc)
2) have estimates created based on planning in Portfolio
3) actuals be recorded based on those milestones being met
fields.summary: Target, Estimate & Actual dates
Error show up in Safari's Private Browsing Mode
Reopening closed linked Jira issue does't reopen Portfolio epic

I want to see vertical grid lines on Initiative and Epic reports
As a project manager I want to add/edit/remove absences to an entire Team or even Plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-85].
  {panel}

It would be helpful to support financial calculations (projected/actual project costs) that Jira would support the following: 

1 - At role level, the ability to define a generalized rate for each role and leverage that for calculations/reports for projected project costs. 

2 - At the user level, the ability to define a user's hourly rate and leverage that for calculations/reports for actual project costs.

These two features would help this process out tremendously.
fields.summary: Financial Reporting Support (Group, User Levels)
As a project manager I want to set fixed start date and / or fixed end date for specific Initiatives / Epics / Stories.
As a project manager I want to see and manage dependencies between several portfolio plans.
As a project manager I want to see the dependencies between Initiatives, Epics and Stories in a gantt like graph.
As a project manager I want to plan a stream with Start Date and End Date
As a project manager I want to manage the resource availability over all plans and not only for one plan.
Automated Time-Tracking Feature in Portfolio Manager w/ Start | Pause | Stop Features

fields.description:
*Situation:*
User creates epics and issues in Portfolio, and links the issues to the epics

*Expected behavior:*
Issues get created, and the Epic Link field in the issues gets populated with the Epic to which they are linked.

*Actual Behavior:*
The Epic Link field is absent from the issues.

*Cause:*
The Create Issue screen related to the issue type you are creating and linking to the Epics does not contain the Epic Link field. As such, the field will not get populated with data, and as a result will not show up on the View Issue screen of the issue.

*Workaround:*
Place the Epic Link field on the Create Issue screen of the issue types you experience this problem with.
fields.summary: No data in Epic link field when creating and linking issues in Portfolio
Ability to copy backlog items

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-76].
  {panel}

Example:

Username: JohnDoe1988
Full Name: John Doe

Username: JohnDoe1980
Full Name: John Doe

If you try and add the user John Doe in the Add Member dialog within the People tab, there is no way to know which one is which.

We should somehow distinguish between these users.
fields.summary: Distinguish between users with identical full names
Add support for importing Epics from JIRA Agile into JIRA Portfolio

The JIRA log files will show an error similar to the following:
{code}/rest/roadmap/1.0/system/filters.json [jira.issue.search.OfBizSearchRequestStore] A JQL query exception was thrown parsing, error loading search request with id 'xxxxx' and name 'xxxxx' owned by 'xxxxx' query 'xxx xxx xxx xxx'.{code}

*Cause*
The query displayed above is incorrect/corrupt, and causes the import function to blow up.

*Resolution*
Find the saved filter in question based on id or filter name as displayed in the error. Remove it from the instance (GUI if possible, else directly in the database) or adjust it in order for it to become a valid filter.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-69].
  {panel}

Currently, it is only possible to share any roadmap with a defined group of people. In a larger company, we want to give everyone access to follow product planning and progress in development, but then everyone could (accidently) change priorities or other values.

Please create at least two general access levels:
* read
* write (i.e. create / edit / run operations such as re-calculations)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-62].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

1. Import an issue with a 3d estimate
2. Change the original estimate on the JIRA Issue to 2d
3. Perform a plan update

Actual result - The Estimate in JIRA Portfolio still shows as 3d
Expected result - The Estimate in JIRA Portfolio shows as 2d

Additional comment - I've been reading the guide, these pages in particular:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolio/Regular+Plan+Updates
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolio/Synchronization+Settings

...and it is very confusing! If you were able to simplify the whole estimate synchronisation functionality that would be great!
fields.summary: Estimates not updating

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-56].
  {panel}

For programs / portfolios with multiple projects underneath, there should be a way to easily add existing Jira projects into a plan created within the portfolio module. 

By selecting an existing project for import users would be able to select the associated boards (scrum/kanban/etc...) of that project, and their associated backlog items they wish to pull into the plan.

This would automatically create the structure of the roadmap, which would be adjusted automatically as items are completed (or not), dates extended (or not), etc... that is being managed via the boards themselves.

In this way the Portfolio module would provide the following structure to a program with multiple projects:

- Overall portfolio
    - Project 1
       - Project 1's backlog items (epics, stories, bugs) / sprints
    - Project 2
       - Project 2's backlog items (epics, stories, bugs) / sprints
    - Project 3
       - Project 3's backlog items (epics, stories, bugs) /sprints
- Overall portfolio roadmap
   - Project 1 specific roadmap
   - Project 2 specific roadmap
   - Project 3 specific roadmap

This would remove duplication of effort between the Agile and Portfolio module, and simplify the process to create a portfolio's structure.
fields.summary: Add the ability to import projects, and their underlying structure into a portfolio plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-55].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 24 March 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting! This issue is being addressed as part of the all new Portfolio live plans, which feature an entirely overhauled and more seamless integration model with JIRA Software / Agile. Live plans are currently available as a labs feature for both Server* and Cloud, so you can start evaluating them without any risk of impacting existing Portfolio plans. They are not yet feature-complete, we're working on bringing all major capabilities of standard plans back into live plans on top of the new integration model before we graduate live plans out of labs and make them the new standard way of working. 
Please check out this blog for a summary and short videos of how the top-voted suggestions are being addressed with live plans: [Top 10 suggestions addressed in live plans|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2016/03/10-user-suggestions-addressed-in-portfolio-for-jira/] and join our [Portfolio Pioneers LinkedIn group|https://www.linkedin.com/groups/7018171] to discuss feedback and best practices!
 
Thanks,
Martin Suntinger
[msuntinger@atlassian.com|mailto:msuntinger@atlassian.com]
Principal Product Manager, Portfolio for JIRA
 
^*The live plans labs feature is available with Portfolio for JIRA 1.12 or higher. It is compatible with JIRA Software 7.0.5 or higher, and JIRA 6.3 or higher, in association with JIRA Agile 6.7.12 or higher.^
{panel}

Currently, resources cannot be shared between plans. As the doc explains:

"plans are completely logically separate and do not consider in any way data from other plans. This means, that the same user could be booked in parallel plans for the same time slot."

Here are some unfortunate consequences:

* JPO could not be used by an organization of any size for global resource planning.
* If one is trying to use JPO for an area with a number of independent projects and shared resources, there is no good solution:
** If you throw everything into one big plan, you make "plan updates" problematic, since the results affect the entire plan and may need to be coordinated with many different people who are supposed to be working independently of each other - probably impractical. Furthermore, by mixing independent projects into one plan, you make the plan too "big" for comfort. (But it is true that JPO offers features like release streams and initiatives that help here. However, it looks like JPO might provide sub-plan objects like release streams to work around the problem that plans have to be bigger than they naturally would be, due to the fact that resource sharing is not possible. ).
** If you create separate plans, you have problems allocating resources. You have to be careful to look at how a person is allocated in each plan to make sure the allocation doesn't exceed his total available hours. And you have make arrangements for him not being overbooked for a given period of time. All this without JPO support.

I think the solution is to move the "People" feature out of the plan and into a bigger object - e.g. "Organization". Here one would specify people and allocate them for given periods of time to plans. The plans would then have to work with the resource constraints handed down from the organization.
fields.summary: Resources should be shared between plans.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-53].
  {panel}

It would be great to keep the plan in sync with JIRA in a similar fashion that JIRA Structure took.
* automatically add items to the plan when added or linked to Epic/Story
* add or remove based on saved filter or JQL
* allow to include dependent or linked issues in the import

This would be a great help for quite common scenario where there already is a complex hierarchy in JIRA created by Stories in Epic as well as issue links, that needs to get transferred (and kept in sync!) to JIRA Portfolio.

Thanks for your consideration!

Setting up Stages and Skills by Story Type and assigning a Story Type to a Story would solve this Problem.

Rg. Sascha

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Download the plan attached ([^Matheus Test.xml]);
# Import it into the latest JIRA and JIRA Portfolio;
# Click on 'Recalculate' on the top of the plan.

This is the offending configuration:
||!offending.png|thumbnail!||

h4. Current Behavior:
JIRA Portfolio shows the following error:
{noformat:borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException :start point must be smaller end point

  at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument:125
  at com.radiantminds.util.function.MutableBoundedStepFunction.<init>:23
  at com.radiantminds.roadmap.common.scheduling.trafo.teams.common.avail.ResourceAvailabilityCreator.createAvailability:87
  at com.radiantminds.roadmap.common.scheduling.trafo.teams.common.WorkFunctionCreator.tryCreateWorkSlotAvailbility:55
{noformat}

h4. Workaround
# Find the offending entry through the Database with the following query:
{code:SQL| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
SELECT plan."TITLE" AS "Plan", team."TITLE" AS "Team", person."TITLE" AS "Person", av."AVAILABILITY", av."START_DATE", av."END_DATE"
	FROM "AO_A415DF_AOAVAILABILITY" av 
	JOIN "AO_A415DF_AORESOURCE" res ON res."ID_OTHER" = av."AORESOURCE_ID"
	JOIN "AO_A415DF_AOPERSON" person ON person."ID_OTHER" = res."AOPERSON_ID"
	JOIN "AO_A415DF_AOTEAM" team ON team."ID_OTHER" = res."AOTEAM_ID"
	JOIN "AO_A415DF_AOPLAN" plan ON plan."ID_OTHER" = team."AOPLAN_ID"
WHERE av."END_DATE" IS NULL ;
{code}
(!) The query above was created using PostgreSQL - if using a different DBMS, you may need to update the query accordingly.
# Verify the *Availability in Team* of the user / team / plan returned with the query above and edit any '*Exceptions*' set *To: Unlimited*. 

h5. Notes:
The database shows:
{code:SQL| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
SELECT person."TITLE", av."AVAILABILITY", av."START_DATE", av."END_DATE"
	FROM "AO_A415DF_AOAVAILABILITY" av 
	JOIN "AO_A415DF_AORESOURCE" res ON res."ID_OTHER" = av."AORESOURCE_ID"
	JOIN "AO_A415DF_AOPERSON" person ON person."ID_OTHER" = res."AOPERSON_ID"
WHERE person."TITLE" = 'Matheus Fernandes';
{code}
{noformat:borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
       TITLE       | AVAILABILITY |  START_DATE   | END_DATE
-------------------+--------------+---------------+----------
 Matheus Fernandes |           40 | 1412035200000 |
{noformat}
\\
*After resolving the problem* by setting the 'To' field in the availability exception to a fixed date, this is in the database:
{noformat:borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
       TITLE       | AVAILABILITY |  START_DATE   |   END_DATE
-------------------+--------------+---------------+---------------
 Matheus Fernandes |           40 | 1412035200000 | 1414627200000
{noformat}
\\

(!) This problem *does not* seem to happen if the *To* date in the availability configuration is actually set to a date before the *From* date.
fields.summary: JPO throws IllegalArgumentException when user has an availabilty exception where the 'To' date is set to unlimited

Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting! This issue is being addressed as part of the all new Portfolio live plans, which feature an entirely overhauled and more seamless integration model with JIRA Software / Agile. Live plans are currently available as a labs feature for both Server* and Cloud, so you can start evaluating them without any risk of impacting existing Portfolio plans. They are not yet feature-complete, we're working on bringing all major capabilities of standard plans back into live plans on top of the new integration model before we graduate live plans out of labs and make them the new standard way of working. 
Please check out this blog for a summary and short videos of how the top-voted suggestions are being addressed with live plans: [Top 10 suggestions addressed in live plans|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2016/03/10-user-suggestions-addressed-in-portfolio-for-jira/] and join our [Portfolio Pioneers LinkedIn group|https://www.linkedin.com/groups/7018171] to discuss feedback and best practices!

Martin Suntinger
[msuntinger@atlassian.com|mailto:msuntinger@atlassian.com]
Principal Product Manager, Portfolio for JIRA
 
^*The live plans labs feature is available with Portfolio for JIRA 1.12 or higher. It is compatible with JIRA Software 7.0.5 or higher, and JIRA 6.3 or higher, in association with JIRA Agile 6.7.12 or higher.^
{panel}

Here are the steps I follow:

1. Create an Epic in JIRA Portfolio.
2. Import some Stories from JIRA that have no Epic link and make them children of the Epic in Portfolio.
3. Within Portfolio, create an issue for the Epic.

Actual result - The Epic is created but has no links to it's child stories in JIRA.
Desired result - The new Epic issue should be linked to the existing Story issues in JIRA.

I hope that makes sense! If not then please let me know and I'll try to provide further clarification.

Please allow the import of dependencies to other issues.

E.g. a depencie is given in a JIRA issue by setting a link from one issue to an other, using the link type "depending on". By importing the issue into JIRA Portfolio, the linked issue should be set as "required" in JIRA Portfolio.

This way all relevant information can be set by the assignee in the JIRA issue (estimation, dependencies).
